*Gap indicates the difference between White and African American voters.

Source: Shelby County v. Holder, 2013
content.question: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from the table?

choices.label: Voter suppression did not occur in the Midwest in 1965.
Barriers to registration existed in all of the states in the table but were most significant in Mississippi.
The increase in voting registration among African Americans likely reduced the incentive for White citizens to register.
States with the highest African American registration rates in 1965 had the lowest rates in 2004 because there were fewer new voters to register.

content.answer: Barriers to registration existed in all of the states in the table but were most significant in Mississippi.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
